intro: Trichostema lanatum var. denudatum, commonly known as the naked stork's bill, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while the flowers are usually pale blue or purple. This variety is distinguished by its reduced leaf coverage, giving it a more open appearance compared to other varieties of Trichostema. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
